channel.title: Single Page Apps :: CIS 526 Textbook
channel.description: Client-side frameworks often focus on creating single page apps. In this pattern, the entire website consists of a single HTML page with very little content, mostly the <script> elements to download a large client-side JavaScript library. Once downloaded, this library populates the page with HTML content by directly manipulating the DOM. Consider a drawing application for creating pixel art. It is entirely possible to write a single-page application that only needs a webserver to serve its static HTML and JavaScript files.
